intro: Phymosia rzedowskii, commonly known as the Mexican rock rose, is a flowering plant native to Mexico. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, which includes legumes, and is characterized by its compound leaves and showy, pink to red flowers. The plant is typically shrub-like, with woody stems and small, oval-shaped leaves. It thrives in rocky or limestone soils and is often found in arid or semi-arid environments. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
